intro: Mesosphaerum laniflorum, commonly known as the woolly-flowered mesosphaerum, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage that provides insulation against extreme temperatures. Its small, white or pale pink flowers are clustered in spherical inflorescences, giving it a distinctive appearance. It is adapted to survive in dry conditions with deep root systems and reduced leaf surface area.
